creator: mpassell@grovehillsoftware.com
text: If you call the DataSourceFactory.parsePoolProperties() method, passing in a Properties object with the "suspectTimeout" property set, that key/value pair is never passed on to the PoolProperties.setSuspectTimeout() method.

creator: mpassell@grovehillsoftware.com
text: I'm already working on a fix for this.  I'll try to add in any other missing properties I notice.  I'll attach a patch when it's done.

creator: mpassell@grovehillsoftware.com
text:
Created attachment 25391
Adds constant and property handling for suspectTimeout to DataSourceFactory

I added the constant PROP_SUSPECT_TIMEOUT and code to read the "suspectTimeout" property from the Properties object, parse it to an int, and pass it into PoolProperties.setSuspectTimeout().  I looked over all the other fields of PoolProperties and it looks like there are being properly converted.
